name: Sarah Burke
bio:
My work in healthcare started long before I became a nurse. I started out as a nurse's aide at a convent near my town. The nurses there encouraged me to pursue an education in nursing. After that, I worked as a CNA and a CMT at a local nursing home. It was the hardest work I have ever done, but it was worth it. Everyday I miss the connections I made taking care of those residents every day.

While I was working full time as a CNA, I pursued my BSN through Missouri Western State University. There I encountered some of the best nurses and educators I have ever met. I graduated with my BSN in December 2023. I was fortunate to land my dream job in a 24-bed mixed ICU.

The variety of patients is astounding. I care for pulmonary, neuro, cardiac, trauma, post-surgical, and all the patients in between. I manage the care of patients with many medical devices such as Impellas, intra-aortic balloon pump, ventriculostomies, Swan-Ganz catheters, CRRT, and ventilators. I manage the care of critically ill patients requiring ventilators, sedation, and vasoactive medications. I have assisted providers in many procedures such as arterial line insertion, bronchoscopies, intubation, and central line insertion. Additionally, I have spent my time in the ICU expanding my knowledge by obtaining my CCRN and CMC.

Outside of work I enjoy running 5Ks with my grandma, watching Kansas City Chiefs games, and walking my beloved dog, Daisy. However, my favorite activity is watching Hallmark Christmas movies with my boyfriend, Abel.

education.title: Registered Nurse
education.issuer: National Council of State Boards of Nursing

education.title: Cardiac Surgical Unit - Advanced Life Support

bullets: Managing care of critically ill patients in a mixed ICU setting.

Assessing patients and administering medications as prescribed by physicians.

Assist with patient check in and post-donation refreshments.
Delegating and overseeing care provided by CNAs during shifts.
Administering Medications and Assessing Patients.
Documenting ADLs, Vitals, Assessments, and Medication Administration.
Assisting patients with all ADLs; including bathing, eating, and ambulating.
